titleStmt.title: A scourge for paper-persecutors. Or Papers complaint, compil'd in ruthfull rimes, against the paper-spoylers of these times. / By I.D. With a continu'd iust inquisition of the same subiect, fit for this season. Against paper-persecutors. By A.H.
Scourge of folly. Selections
titleStmt.author: Davies, John, 1565?-1618.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A19909 of text S109362 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 6340). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 42 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 18 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: A scourge for paper-persecutors. Or Papers complaint, compil'd in ruthfull rimes, against the paper-spoylers of these times. / By I.D. With a continu'd iust inquisition of the same subiect, fit for this season. Against paper-persecutors. By A.H.
Scourge of folly. Selections
titleStmt.author: Davies, John, 1565?-1618.
Holland, Abraham, d. 1626. Continued inquisition against paper-persecutors.
Hartwell, Abraham, b. 1553, attributed name.

publicationStmt.publisher: For H. H[olland] and G. G[ibbs] and are to be sold at the Golden Flower Deluce in Popes-head Alley,

notesStmt.note: The first part is reprinted from Davies' "The scourge of folly".
Title page in red and black.
"A continued inquisition against paper-persecutors. By A.H.", i.e. Abraham Holland, has separate pagination and register. This part has also been attributed to Abraham Hartwell.
A reissue of the 1624 edition, with added title page. The original title page is present in most copies, and is included in pagination above.
Variant: the second "u" in "ruthfull" is turned.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

keywords.term: Book industries and trade -- Poetry -- Early works to 1800.
